title: Tim Henman
summary: Timothy Henry Henman OBE (born 6 September 1974) is a British retired professional tennis player. Henman played a serve-and-volley style of tennis. He was the first male player from the United Kingdom since Roger Taylor in the 1970s to reach the semi-finals of the Wimbledon Men's Singles Championship. Henman never reached a final of any Grand Slam but reached six Grand Slam semi-finals and won 15 career ATP titles (11 in singles and 4 in doubles), including the Paris Masters in 2003. He also scored 40 wins and 14 losses with the Great Britain Davis Cup team.
